summary: A subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to T-Mobile, commanding the company to appear in court and produce subscriber records for a specific phone number from 2000-2005 for the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) for which the subpoena is issued to obtain phone records.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed and issued the subpoena.

events.title: Scheduled Court Appearance for T-Mobile
events.description: T-Mobile is commanded to appear before the U.S. District Court to testify and produce subscriber records for a specific phone number from 2000-2005.

locations: 40 Foley Square, Courtroom 906, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena seeks T-Mobile subscriber records for a specific phone number from the period 2000-2005.
The records are demanded for use in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
Failure to comply constitutes contempt of court and subjects the recipient to civil sanctions and criminal penalties.
The subpoena was issued by U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss on July 28, 2021, for an appearance scheduled on November 29, 2021.
